FPS게임의 클래식 그 자체
레벨 디자인이 탄탄하며 게임 속에서 맞닥트리는 퍼즐역시 푸는 재미가 있다 또한 스토리가 게임 속에 자연스럽게 녹아들어 게임을 하면서 몰입할 수 있었다
타격감 역시 현재의 게임들과 비교해봐도 꿀리지 않으며 총을 쏘는 맛이 있다 
이러한 요소들 덕분에 게임을 하는 내내 지루하지 않고 즐거웠다
단 한가지 아쉬운점은 게임을 진행하는데 있어 약간 불친절 하다는 점 그러나 90년대 게임이라는 것을 감안하며 충분히 봐줄수 있는 요소

timeless classic

I bought and played this game because it is one of the most well known and famous games out there.  I expected it to be good, and I suppose it was cool for its time, but it's a piece of trash now.  

The 16 hours I spent on this game were spent saving, saving, saving, and doing sections over and over again.  I only finished one playthrough.  Perhaps I'm just a bad player, but I had to repeat the same sections many times because I would come into the section with like 5 health, able to be one-shotted by a single round.  When you don't have any charge in your HEV suit, enemies do a /lot/ of damage.  For the final boss, I ended up using noclip and god commands because I just wanted to be done.

Again, this game feels like endless grinding, all to uncover a cool scene or piece of the story that's not there.  Instead of buying this game, play Half Life 2.  It's so much more entertaining and is worth your time.

The graphics could have aged better, and i am not entirely hooked on the story like everyone else is(or even understand it still), but i did like the gameplay, i said the graphics could have aged better, but this still looks good! And, with the ability to play online deathmatch servers(or other game modes!), its really replayable! I say, everyone try this! Not terrible at all, but not the #1 best game in the world, GREAT soundtrack, and you can play online servers! :)

Саму игру можно заслуженно считать классикой. В ней хорошая если не самая лучшая для 98 года графика,прорывной геймплей где у нас не уровни,а несколько огромных карт, но есть и минусы:
1)Чувствуется небольшая затянутость игры ,к примеру когда у нас отбирают всё оружие.
2)Иногда тупо непонятно куда и зачем идти ,а именно когда борешься с Гаргантюа и в других моментах. (не зря фанаты халвы гении)

so basically i played this game because i wanted to play the other half-life games, but instead of making me excited for half-life 2, i became a lot more hesitant to start playing it. 

one of my main problems with this game is that the combat is very clearly split into two parts - a good part, and a bad part. when youre fighting the alien enemies, you can use the super-sonic speed that youve been given and its actually quite a bit of fun. when youre fighting the human enemies, however, the best strategy is to stand as far away from them as possible, since they literally cant hit you if youre too far away, but you can hit them. this leads to boring segments where you hide behind boxes until youre far enough away that you can shoot them without getting hurt. any attempt to take it fast paced will end up with you dying and it just isnt very fun at all.

my next big problem is that when i started playing it, i expected there to be a great story that comes with it, but this is only really partly true. there really are no characters, only blank slates that you run into during your time in the facility. the main character has no personality, which is fine on its own, but combined with the 0 other characters you actually makes it seem hard to care about the story aspect of the game. the most well developed character in the game isnt even a character, but rather the character of the government, which leads to the part of the story that i actually liked a lot: the way it tells the story. if youre not talking to a random scientist or some stupid security guard who tells you what to do and where to go, your main source of story telling is the environment. theres never an explanation (or at least one that i cared enough to listen to) about how anything happens or how it works, it's just there for you to see play out, which i really liked. this part is kind of a spoiler, but happens at almost the start of the game [spoiler] but the game never tells you how the "zombies" are made, it just shows you the head crabs and then later shows you the human with a head crab on its head. [/spoiler] There are many more examples of this kind of storytelling that i really like that i wont go over, but its pretty rare to see that in games.

all in all, it got me to finish it, which isn't very common tbh, but i think that mainly has to do with the fact that i wanted to play half-life 2 after. 

4/10

one of the best  games ever

This game has the same immersive value that it did when I was a much younger man. I'm now a 40-something, and I remember when this game was new and the Valve games cemented their legacy with a combination of great visuals, intuitive controls, and excellent storytelling. For me, it was one of the moments where the storyline value of your average Roberta Williams text-entry game on a 386 met the intensity of the FPS world brought into fruition by Apogee/Id. Here I am, reviewing it as a guy with a career and kids and my adult son and my teenager both played the Half Life games. The only reason I can see not to recommend this game emphatically is if you just have a distaste for the sci-fi dystopia genre or FPS games in general. And, to call it either of those things is reductive. It has a synergy I don't have the words to articulate. Play it.
